name: UEC-CheckServices-Operation
description: This is a FHIR Operation performed by a Directory of Services (DoS). It is performed at a server level at the end of a triage journey with a generic Referral Request defined in order to find a specific set of nearby services which can deal with the patient.

parameter.name: requestId
parameter.documentation: An optional client-provided identifier to track the request.

parameter.name: referralRequest
parameter.documentation: The core of the $check-services operation is based on the outcome of triage, represented as a chief concern, next activity and acuity. These are all captured in the ReferralRequest, so this resource contains all that is required for the outcome of triage.

parameter.name: patient
parameter.documentation: The patient for whom the triage took place. There are a number of patient elements which are used by some of the directories such as age and gender.

parameter.name: location
parameter.documentation: The location represents the patient's current location.

parameter.name: requester
parameter.documentation: The person initiating the the $check-services request. The requester is the user of the EMS. This will typically be a Patient or RelatedPerson if the EMS is being used by a member of the public (e.g. a patient-facting public internet system) or a Practitioner where there has been an initiatingOrganisation as part of the triage.

parameter.name: registeredGPPractice
parameter.documentation: The organization representing the registered GP of the Patient.

parameter.name: inputParameters
parameter.documentation: The input parameters for a request, if any.  These parameters are defined by the Directory of Services that is the target of the check operation.

parameter.name: services
parameter.documentation: The output is a set of HealthcareService resources and related information which can deliver the patient's health needs.

parameter.name: services.parameters
parameter.documentation: Each healthcare service returned MUST have it's own parameter.

parameter.name: services.parameters.name
parameter.documentation: This MUST be populated with the serviceId.

parameter.name: services.parameters.part
parameter.documentation: Named parts of this parameter. This MUST contain a parameter named service which MUST contain the HealthcareService resource. This MAY also contain other implementation-specific information about the HealthcareService such as it's distance from the patient's location or capacity.

parameter.name: outputParameters
parameter.documentation: The output parameters for a request, if any. These parameters are defined by the target DoS.
